title: KAMARINA
content:
KAMARINA (Camarina) was the Okeanid-nymph of the Greek colony of Kamarina in Sicily. She probably represented
        the town's water supply in the form of a spring or fountain.

Pindar, Olympian Ode 5 str1 - ant1 (trans. Conway) (Greek lyric C5th B.C.)
          :
        "Daughter of Okeanos (Oceanus), pray you accept with a glad heart this song . . . for the crowns won at
        Olympia . . . He has raised up your city Kamarina (Camarina), the mother of his people."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
